The Bull Case For C3.ai (AI) Could Change Following Mounting Losses And Insider Selling Learn Why
Simply Wall St
Reviewed by Sasha Jovanovic
- C3.ai has recently been under pressure as revenue declines, operating losses widen, leadership changes add uncertainty, and analysts expect further year-over-year drops in earnings and sales.
- At the same time, persistent insider share sales and mixed analyst opinions highlight growing concern over whether C3.ai can convert AI interest into sustainable enterprise demand.
- We’ll now examine how these mounting operational challenges and cautious sentiment could reshape C3.ai’s investment narrative for investors.
Trump's oil boom is here - pipelines are primed to profit. Discover the 22 US stocks riding the wave.
C3.ai Investment Narrative Recap
To own C3.ai today, you need to believe that its enterprise AI platform can eventually translate growing AI interest into durable, large-scale customer deployments. The latest news of shrinking revenue, deeper losses, and leadership turnover directly pressures the key near term catalyst of improved sales execution, while reinforcing the biggest current risk that C3.ai struggles to reach a sustainable, profitable growth model.
Among recent updates, the projected quarterly earnings per share of -US$0.29 and revenue decline of more than 23% year over year are especially relevant, as they underline the same execution and demand challenges behind the stock’s sharp 2025 drop. These trends sit uncomfortably beside initiatives such as new CEO and commercial leadership appointments, which are intended to address weak unit economics and stalled enterprise adoption.
Read the full narrative on C3.ai (it's free!)
C3.ai's narrative projects $613.6 million revenue and $80.3 million earnings by 2028.
Uncover how C3.ai's forecasts yield a $14.67 fair value, a 5% upside to its current price.
Exploring Other Perspectives
However, investors should also consider how C3.ai’s reliance on hyperscaler partners could become a bigger issue if those same platforms…
Seventeen fair value estimates from the Simply Wall St Community span roughly US$8 to over US$40 per share, with opinions scattered across the full range. Against that backdrop, concerns about persistent operating losses and pressure on margins give you an additional lens to compare these community views and explore several alternative scenarios for C3.ai’s performance.
Explore 17 other fair value estimates on C3.ai - why the stock might be worth over 2x more than the current price!
